title: Introduction
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It helps create reusable UI components and manage state efficiently.
questions: Why use React over vanilla JS or other frameworks?
What are the key features of React?

title: Components
content: Components are reusable building blocks of a React app. They can be functional or class-based, and can manage their own state and props.
questions: Difference between functional and class components?

title: JSX
content: JSX lets you write HTML-like code in React. It's a syntax extension of JavaScript that gets compiled to React.createElement calls.
questions: Why JSX is used in React?
Can we use React without JSX?

title: State
content: State stores data inside a component that can change over time. Updating state re-renders the component to reflect changes.
questions: How do you update state in functional components?

title: Props
content: Props are used to pass data from parent to child components. Props are read-only and cannot be modified by the child.
questions: Can props be changed inside a child component?

title: Hooks
content: Hooks like useState, useEffect let you manage state and lifecycle in functional components. Other hooks include useContext, useReducer, and custom hooks.

title: Routing
content: React Router is used for navigation between pages in a React app. It allows single-page applications to have multiple views.

title: Context API
content: Context API allows global state management without prop drilling. It is useful for sharing data like themes, user info, or language settings.
questions: When should you use Context API?
Difference between Context API and Redux?

title: Forms
content: Forms in React use controlled or uncontrolled components. Controlled components keep form data in the state.
questions: How to handle form submission in React?
How to validate forms in React?

title: Advanced Topics
content: Advanced React topics include HOC (Higher Order Components), Render Props, Error Boundaries, React.memo for optimization, and code splitting.
questions: How to optimize React apps using React.memo?

title: Performance Optimization
content: Optimizing React apps involves techniques like memoization, code splitting, lazy loading components, and avoiding unnecessary renders.
questions: How to use lazy loading in React?
What are pure components for optimization?

title: Testing
content: React testing involves testing components using Jest and React Testing Library to ensure UI behaves as expected.
questions: How to test a React component?
Difference between shallow and full rendering?

title: State Management
content: Managing state globally can be done with Redux, MobX, or Context API depending on app complexity.
questions: Difference between Redux and Context API?
What are actions, reducers, and store in Redux?

title: Styling
content: React components can be styled using CSS, CSS Modules, Styled Components, or libraries like Bootstrap, TailwindCSS.
questions: Difference between CSS Modules and Styled Components?
How to use Bootstrap with React?

title: Deployment
content: React apps can be deployed to platforms like Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, or any static hosting.
questions: How to deploy a React app?
How to handle routing on static hosts?
